content.description: <math alttext="H 3 N with a positive 1 charge C H 2 C O O H aqueous, plus H 2 O liquid, is in equilibrium with H 3 N with a positive 1 charge C H 2 C O O with a negative 1 charge aqueous plus H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>COO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: <math alttext="H 3 N with a positive 1 charge C H 2 C O O with a negative 1 charge aqueous, plus H 2 O liquid, is in equilibrium with H 2 N C H 2 C O O with a negative 1 charge aqueous plus H 3 O with a positive 1 charge aqueous" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>COO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>⇄</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>NCH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>COO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> The stepwise dissociation of the amino acid glycine is represented by the chemical equations above. A student titrates a sample of glycine dissolved in dilute acid with <math alttext="0.100 molar N a O H aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. The data are plotted on the following graph. Based on the data, which of the following species has the highest concentration in an aqueous solution of glycine with a pH of 7?

choices.label: <math alttext="H 3 N with a positive 1 charge C H 2 C O O H aqueous " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msup><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msub><mrow><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>COOH</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>
